Note.Content: ESV "have filled you" NJPS "thronged" NIV "have enriched" CEV "making ... rich" | RSV "your messengers" NJB "whose messengers" GNT "agents" | LXX REB omit
RSV NRSV ESV "they mass themselves" NIV "unite" NJB "they set on me" REB "they are in league" | NJPS "they inflame themselves"
NJB "except" REB "but" | RSV ESV "arms himself" NIV NRSV "uses" NJPS "arm himself"

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left
= process by which objects enter a certain location or container, or cover a certain surface to the extent that little or no space is left
= causative action by which someone causes a certain location, container, or surface to be filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left
literally: to fill oneselves; hence: = action by which humans form a group in order to carry out a certain activity together
= process by which a certain activity come to an end
= process by which a certain amount of time fully elapses
= action by which humans continue with a certain activity until a certain amount of time fully elapses
= causative action by which deities ensure that a certain activity continues until a certain amount of time fully elapses
literally: (one's) right hand is filled (with an activity); hence: = state in which deities are fully engaged in a certain activity

Glosses.Gloss: to be filled > to be engaged

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: literally: (one's) heart is filled (with an activity); hence: = state in which the human mind is fully engaged in a certain way of thinking

Glosses.Gloss: to be filled > to be engaged

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: literally: (one's) loins are filled (with an experience); hence: = state in which the entire human body is affected by a certain emotion

Glosses.Gloss: to be filled > to be engaged

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: literally: (one's) mouth or lips are filled (with an activity); hence: = state in which humans are fully engaged in the communication of certain information

Glosses.Gloss: to be filled > to be engaged

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: literally: to be filled (with an activity); hence: = state in which humans are fully engaged in a certain activity, either as victim or as active participant

Glosses.Gloss: to be filled > to be engaged

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: literally: to fill (with an activity); hence: = causative action in which deities cause humans to be fully engaged in a certain activity, either as victim or as active participant
= state or process by which a location is dominated by a certain event, to the extent that it dominates everything else, ◄ as if it were completely filled with that event

= causative action or process by which deities cause a location to be dominated by a certain activity, to the extent that it dominates everything else, ◄ as if it were completely filled with that event
literally: to fill (words or plans); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause plans or promises to be carried out as intended
= state in which an activity is achieved to a full extent
literally: to fill (something to someone); hence: = causative action by which humans give a full number of objects to someone else
= process by which someone's desire finds relief
literally: to fill; hence: = action by which humans do what is needed to find relief from their desire
literally: to fill; hence: = causative action by which deities cause humans to find relief from their desire
literally: to fill (someone's) hands; hence: = causative action by which someone ordains another person to be a priest
literally: to fill (someone's) face with shame; hence: = causative action by which deities cause humans to be deeply ashamed in such a way that it shows on their faces
literally: to fill; hence: = causative action by which a craftsman attaches a mounted stone on a certain surface
literally: to fill; hence: = action by which humans put an arrow on the string of a bow in order to shoot it
literally: to fill (one's) mouth (with arguments); hence: = action by which humans are actively engaged in speaking
literally: to fill (one's) hand on the bow; hence: = action by which someone draws his bow in order to shoot an arrow
literally: (one's) heart is filled (to do something); hence: = state in which someone is fully determined to carry out a certain activity
literally: they fill behind (someone); hence: = state in which humans are wholeheartedly in support of someone else
probably read אִם לֹא
